text: Leonie Reynolds (born 10 April 1968) is an Irish judge who has served as a Judge of the High Court since October 2016. She previously served as a Judge of the Circuit Court from 2010 to 2016. She was a Judge of the Circuit Court since January 2010. On 27 July 2016, the Government of Ireland agreed in principle to nominate Judge Reynolds, for appointment by the President of Ireland, as a Judge of the High Court, once an expected vacancy arose. She was educated at University College Dublin and King's Inns. She was called to the Irish Bar in 1993. She has served as a Member of the Special Criminal Court since October 2015. As of 2020, Reynolds is the Judge in Charge of the Chancery List of the High Court, which encompasses cases involving equity and company law. Judge Reynolds is the daughter of Albert Reynolds, former Taoiseach of Ireland.https://www.irishtimes.com/news/crime-and-law/albert- reynolds-s-daughter-nominated-as-high-court-judge-1.2736602 ==References== Category:Living people Category:High Court judges (Ireland) Category:Alumni of University College Dublin Category:Irish barristers Category:Circuit Court (Ireland) judges Category:Irish women lawyers Category:Irish women judges Category:1968 births Category:Alumni of King's Inns
title: Leonie Reynolds
